review: It's rare that I visit a chain resto, but since I was in Fresno to meet a friend for lunch on New Year's Day it really was the only option.  I've always liked CPK, since back in the day I ate at the original WELL before it was a chain restaurant, in Beverly Hills. I love their pizzas, salads and other items I've tried, lately, esp. the drinks!  We wanted dessert but everything was just too heavy on the dairy for my lactose intolerance, so we had to pass.  What made it special though was we told our server who was great, we just wanted to sit and catch up.  Because it was a holiday and we were there very late, it was no problem, no one made us feel we had to get out and the service was stellar.

I come here quite often whenever I'm in town. The service is okay but the food lives up to the CPK chain expectations. Typically you would not except to have a long wait to get a table.  Some go-to items I like to get are the spinach artichoke dip, Kung pao spaghetti and the Sicilian pizza. The dip is my favorite appetizer and they usually give you extra chips if you find there are leftovers at the end. I usually get the spaghetti without any meats because they don't give much and it costs extra. The Sicilian pizza comes on a thin crust and I believe they charge extra if you prefer to have a thicker crust. It comes with Italian sausages, basil and salami

Really like the pasta and pizza here. Service is usually pretty nice (there was one time where it wasnt very busy and the server took about 30 minutes to take our drink order. We ordered water and left. We just didn't think it was worth it. Today unfortunately I ordered the Pesto Penne and added chicken. Not impressed. 5 pieces? Yeah. No.

The service is good here but the food isn't. It looks and sounds great on the menu but I've yet to get anything here that has been decent. This last round was a take-out order of dumplings or potstickers. At over $10.00, I received 6 mushy, jelly fish like, dumplings. The filling was chicken because they don't have pork. It's was pee gravel grainy and not moist and juicy inside. The dipping sauce was the star here, sweet and wonderfully spicy. My last meal here was a rip, too. So much so that it inspired my last disappointing, ho-hum, review. California Pizza Kitchen: The idea is always better than the reality and because they essentially skimp on EVERYTHING, it's a place I will not bother with again. I'm not a cheap person but neither will I tolerate the weak offering here and the lousy value. Put some dang food on the plates! -G

Had a quick Friday afternoon lunch with a friend last week and had a pleasant enough experience. We arrived at 1pm and there were only 2 free tables - the place was absolutely packed. Maybe because schools are out for summer? We were seated right away but service was pretty slow. Our waitress was friendly and acknowledged how busy it was and that there'd been a wait, so she was realistic with us.  I'd had pizza a couple of nights beforehand, so I ordered a lunch combo - half chicken club sandwich, half superfood salad. My friend got the BBQ chicken salad which she's had a few times and enjoys. My meal was filling - the superfood salad has some quinoa, walnuts, spinach, and cranberries. The sandwich was on a brioche roll, really sweet, it was sweeter than I usually enjoy but since it was just a half sandwich it balanced nicely with the salty bacon. Total with an iced tea and tip was $17 - more than I'd usually spend on lunch. It reminded me that this place is here and has pretty good food, though, so I'll probably come back for a pizza sometime.

This is one of the best pizzas I've ever eaten Jamaican Jerk Chicken Pizza. I also had they're half and half soup bowl with tortilla soup and garden squash soup for $7.50 incredible and then their bread dipped in seasoned olive oil stand accompaniment period I am not a chain person I go for the Mom and Pop eateries but the quality at this place is amazing

Fine.  This location delivered as expected.  The drinks included the sangria flight, the red wine flight.  The red wine flight was fine:  Coppola red was the best of the J Lohr and the La Crema Pinot.  I enjoyed the kung pao spaghetti, but the only reason I order it is because I make the dish at home and I wanted to compare (mine is better).  The half salads were generous and I can't speak about them other than they were eaten.    It's an ok place to get satisfying food.   All that's all I'll say about that!
Service was good but the food did not wow me. For what we paid for I was expecting more. I don't think I'll give it another try.
Always great food at this one and nice service. I get take out a lot here. I also think it's a very fun location. My kids love it here also.
Never disappointed. I love the pasta I get here and my husband loves the pizza he gets here! Chicken piccata plate and chipotle pizza AmAzInG!!!! Service is always on point!!!
Love the whole visit. Nice people,  good service and good food. Simple put, worth the time while you're hitting Costco, Sam's club or Edwards 16. Try it you will see.

Saturday night in Fresno, we walked in at 9pm with a boys XC team. Given their proximity to the state course, they didn't blink. Portion sizes were good, everyone found something to eat and cleared their plates. At that time it was a ghost town but they do not take reservations so plan accordingly. I ordered a mojito which was fine but sprigs of mint would have been preferable to the diced within an inch of its life mint. They had gluten free pizza and possibly pasta and an array of composed salads. Our service was efficient.

So I order curbside to go and showed up a couple min after the quoted time just in case they were busy I didn't want to wait .Well that did not work I waited while three employees walked past my car and all said nothing to me finally I called, the woman on the phone said I'll let someone know that your out there how are you paying I told her I already did she hung up over 5 min later someone came to my car and handed me my pizza no receipt no smile NOTHING WTF and the pizza wasn't even warm Disappointing

To be honest there food was not that great, it was bland with not many flavor. The drinks had an unexpected taste, which I didn't really like. I was hoping for a good meal, but didn't finish it. Maybe I can try other items on the menu , but I'm not sure if I'll go back. As from the food, the people were friendly.

We always have a great time here! Juan and Carolin were super friendly and squeezed us in during the busy lunch to let the little one have his turn making a pizza!  We did this for years ago and now it was little brother's turn!  Thank you guys for another great experience!

This place is very friendly and welcoming. Great customer service. The complimentary bread was so delicious. I got a spinach dip that wasn't good I don't recommend it here, but I got the barbecue chicken pizza and that was delicious the chicken on it was cooked very well and the crust is different than all the other places in a good way.

This is my go to place in north Fresno and over the past couple of years I have not been disappointed.  The Pizza is great, really love the crust and toppings.  I've been here probably a dozen times and have never been disappointed.  The service has always been efficient and fast. Best Pizza in Fresno.  You can't ask for more than that.

The food is good but they got rid of my favorite pizza, the pear and Gorgonzola.  That really stinks.  They did this once before and brought it back because people complained.  I plan on sending an email to corporate.  I got the Spinach and artichoke pizza today.  It wasn't bad but I miss my favorite.
First time I used the delivery system with Yelp and could not be more pleased. Cpk had everything packed and organized beautifully. Food was fantastic and delivered as ordered. Well worth it.

BEWARE!!!!! This place really doesn't care about customer service or it's take out/curbside  quality assurance at all. First to go item: The Thai Crunch salad in house is awesome-peanuts, veggies and rice sticks.    But.... when you get it to go and get all the away home- is doesn't have any peanuts and no veggies!! Second to go:  We ordered the salted caramel pudding and when we got it home, they had switched out the salted caramel pudding with hummus!!!   It made me so sick, I vomited and my husband was trying hard to not vomit.    They fooled us!    How could you not know that you're making the hummus look like a dessert?!  We called and spoke to the manager and he was indifferent about what happened to us.  He was so indifferent that it almost felt that it was a joke designed to ruin our experience.   Like immature staff playing a practical joke on a customer.  NO CUSTOMER SERVICE AT ALL!! So, beware when ordering food to go because it seems that there is a lack of proper supervision on the quality of the food being made.
Hadn't been to CPK for awhile. Lunch was great. Had the sicilian thin crust pizza and the thai crunch salad. Great combo.

I don't get in here very often, but everytime I do.  I'm never disappointed.   My go to Dallas is the Thai Chicken Salad.  It has a bit of a bite to it, but I love the variety of flavors, crunch and veggies it has.  Edamame is my favorite ingredient.
Great place to eat.   The manager was extremely attentive, and Ashley was an awesome waitress.  My wife and I will return there many more times.  Great staff and management.
James was the best server!! So helpful and attentive. The management is great as well as the food!

I've never understood this place. I mean back in the 90's when it was a cool business model to put a new hip spin on an old classic, Starbucks you're my Rachel, and CPK you're my Ross. CPKs food is basically over priced flatbread and horrible salads. I don't care you have a bar. Not much going on here.  Much like the TV show Friends, CPK has not aged well with its white button ups tucked into their jeans like they're competing with Ellen in a mom pants contest. To refer back, Rachel and Starbucks you went on to become more relevant and seductive over the years. CPK, you are a bit of a dinosaur just waiting for a meteor to completely crater your business. One day a Jewish paleontologist from New York named Ross will unearth you and declare you permanently extinct while sipping from a warm hot cup of arabica Rachel goodness. I wish CPK nothing but failure and perhaps the restaurant space will one day be filled with something worthy of that elite corner location like say another Starbucks.  Nothing personally to the staff as they are kind and friendly enough. I doubt they'll have a hard time finding another restaurant gig in river park. There are as many restaurants to choose from in River Park as there are triple-bypass patients at the heart hospital up the street. And as anyone knows service skills are easily transferable. As longs as the patrons keep coming, and the doors stay open don't listen to me CPK staff. But honestly it's flat bread, have some pride. It's a one trick pony. Without sauces you've got nothing...just saying. Three stars for service, minus one for food. Total, 2 stars.
Very highly recommend  these people brought us food on the rough fire for donation and it was some of the best food I have had.Thank you for your support  california pizza kitchen

Best gluten free pizza I have ever had!  Seriously really good crust! I ordered off the regular menu so it wasn't certified gluten free, but they do have 5 certified gluten free pizzas. I have never had a gluten free crust that wasn't chewy and nearly un edible. This crust was fluffy and soft. Very very good!

Good was good. Wait wasn't too bad, average. Service was not good. We had to flag our waitress down several times, she never checked on us. The other servers had a "you're not out table" attitude. I might give a try one more time, but for being my first time it was not good.

Please read this! This is a fatal warning. I'm very disappointed. Really. We got the take-out, since my mom was too busy to cook. We ordered three pizzas and the Kung-pao chicken spaghetti. Horrible service. We ordered the food, and waited at a nearby empty nearby booth. We couldn't sit in the waiting area because there were people sitting there already. We waited for about 20 minutes and the waitress behind the counter still didn't call our name. The people sitting in the waiting area left, so we moved there. We waited for a couple more minutes, and my mom went up to the waitress and asked if they were done with our food. The waitress asked for our name and checked a shelf under the counter in front of her. It turns out that the food had been sitting there for about 15 minutes. The waitress argued that since we weren't sitting at the waiting area, she didn't call our name. My mom told her that there were people sitting left and we moved there. The waitress just shrugged and didn't even offer a "sorry". My mom asked for some utensils and she only gave us one pack, even though we ordered three pizzas and one spaghetti. When we were leaving, the waitress caught up to us and put three small cups of sauce into the bag and said she forgot to give them to us. When we got home, we found out that she didn't place the cups right side up and were leaking all over the bag. The bag was stained with oil. The food portion is only average and way overpriced.                 Don't go there. I don't think we will ever again.

First off all, I need to give a HUGE thank you to Kelly the general manager. He is the best manager I have ever met. Had my sons birthday party there today and he made it worth every penny. He takes the kids on a tour of the kitchen, lets them make their own pizza, and gives them ice cream sundaes. I highly recommend this place.

Came in 15 min before close on a Monday night. One busser, tall in shape white guy? Was incredibly rude when I asked if the kitchen was still open so I could get a pizza to go. Ignored me, then when I asked a littlr louder he turned and said "idk" and went back to bussing. Also managers should never run food if they r not going to ask if there is anything else the guest needs for their meal. Food is great, server was real good to.

We went for lunch and the place was pretty busy however the waiter was attentive as he could be with a full house. Excellent fresh tasting salads and pizzas. The fried macaroni and cheese appetizer was super yummy. Very reasonably priced lunch specials.

Just had dinner here a few days ago after not eating here for several years, mainly because my husband doesn't care for CPK. I had my usual "go-to" Thai Crunch Salad. It was okay ... it bad, but didn't excite me either. The chicken in the salad almost seemed fake, it was almost had the look of tilapia. They use to serve this salad with chopsticks which makes it more fun to eat. No chopsticks this visit, only an ordinary fork. Our server was very attentive and always made sure our drinks were full.

My mom and I go to to CPK often and usually have great service. I went with a few people for a special occasion yesterday, including my mom. It took a long time just to order, and we saw our server walking back and forth, not making eye contact with us...and with two small kids that was hard to just sit and wait that long...just to order. Then we all ordered our food and it took a long time to get our food...we ordered basically all salads and soups...cant take that long to plate. The kids orders came back great...besides that, everything was wrong..we had to send a few things back and or deal with the mistake and say nothing because it just wasn't worth it. My mother is allergic to cheese and she asked for ranch, specifically ranch, no blue cheese on her salad and they brought out blue cheese, on the salad. She gagged at the table and I told the waitress the issue and the manager came over, with her hands in the air, and said," I can guarantee you this is ranch, okay??" And put the salad back in front of her... We were stunned the attitude from this manager, who normally is very nice. A few minutes later she came back with a change of attitude saying, "oh you know what, ill have them remake it just in case there is more cheese in there..."  After that, the waitress was more attentive with our refills on tea and bread but before that, she was basically non existent.  I asked for separate tabs and all the tabs were on one tag, and it took about 20 min to just get the card back to sign the receipt.   It was ridiculous, the lunch was ruined and the service was horrible. CPK used to be a staple lunch place for us and we probably will never go back at this point.
I like CPK... hard to justify spending this much on Pizza now that Pieology exists, but it is still a good place for a more "formal" atmosphere.

Had my son's 6th birthday party here and the service was phenomenal. The manager on duty that day (forgot her name) was very accommodating. I highly recommend throwing your child's next bday party here. Very well organized and affordable.

We went on a weekday just a few minutes before closing. There were some parties who still looked like they were still waiting for their food. We were very pleased with how professional they handled it. They said absolutely not, did not rush us, and treated us as if the time was not an issue. Of course, we did our best to order quickly, eat, and pay. But, we were surprised how nice hey were. You can tell that this is a well-managed restaurant that puts customer service first.

Don't eat or buy the frozen pizza from this place. Go to the restuarant if you can the food is soo much better. The Strawberry lemonaide is Fantastic I would have drank 5 if I could. My Asian salad was very good and so was my Chicken pizza. Service was really great. If I had a CPK in my area I would eat there often.

This place is amazing! We came on a field trip & they offered us a smorgasbord of pizzas. We tried the Thai chicken, Hawaiian BBQ chicken, & pear w/Gorgonzola which were all fantastic! The kids had individual pepperoni pizzas which they devoured. Everything was so amazing! The Manager Kelly was so accommodating to our severely handicapped students. His kindness was tremendously appreciated. A+++ for service & effort. I highly recommend CPK!

So went there with the office ladies.  Group of 8.  Took a bit to throw some tables together and it wasn't crowded yet.  Sat down, got our drink orders.  Just took a while to get back.  Then left, she came back in an approrpriate amount of time to take our food order.  But it took FOREVER to get the food.  We all fianlly got our food.  I ordered the 4 cheese ravioli.  The sauce was ok.  Some type of tomato cream sauce.  The ravioli was WAY over cooked.  Very limp, the stuffing came out of a few of them so I had a lot of empty limp raviolis in there.  Like... really really over cooked.  For the price of like $14 I expected a little more.  I will personally never choose to go here.  Got done with the food, then it took forever for the check processing.  Just an all around blah experience.

We always have good service.  Managers are present and involved.  Everything tasted fresh and flavorful during our last visit, from the complementary bread and dipping oil to the Butter Cake at the end.  The Thai Crunch salad has the best mix of ingredients!  And I hope they keep the seasonal unsweetened tropical tea.  They also have really good lunch specials.  I do miss that one "pizza" they had that was like a Parmesan crust, topped with a light salad with vinaigrette.

The pizza here is great...you really cant go wrong. I have been a CPK fan for many years and was here yesterday to get a sick relative something to eat.  Instead of getting my order to-go, I decided to dine in. The hostess was in an almost zombie like state, she took us to our table, laid the menus down and muttered something about wanting to eat my brains...I kid, I kid. I don't have brains, lol. She did not tell me about the specials, she just laid the 'specials' menu down. She never once said who my server was, enjoy my meal or anything.  My waitress was good, but a little on the slow side. I asked for a refill on my soda and it took her over 10 min to come back. She was even slow with the table behind me, and they ended up being compensated for that...that's how slow she was. Unfortunately I was not compensated ;( Anyways, my server was great to tell me about the specials and their current promotions. Right now if you sign up for their e-mail membership, you get a FREE small plate app. You can either register online or on the card in house. For my free app, I opted for the Fried Mac n Cheese. It did not come out the way in which my server described, so I was kind of bummed. It was four tiny little fried balls with a little bit of cheese sauce. I do have to say, the panko breading was REALLY crispy and good. The mac n cheese tasted like Velveeta, which isn't bad if you like Velveeta. The cheese had a really generic flavor, I expected more from CPK since they are all 'gourmet' and fancy. I personally would not order them again. For my main entrée I went with the crowd favorite...BBQ Chicken Pizza. It was served piping hot within minutes after I ordered it, and was brought to me by the Chef himself...perhaps he knew that my server was slower than a snail and didn't want my food getting cold. The pizza was near perfection. There was an abundance of toppings from the cilantro, onions, chicken all the way to the BBQ sauce. The dough was super warm and had a nice crisp to it. Only complaint about the dough was that it tasted a tad too salty. The atmosphere has changed over the years, not sure for the better. The pizza prices continue to climb, but the service and ambience have been going down. They used to have your silverware wrapped in a black cloth napkin, and now you get it rolled in a generic brown paper napkin. You no longer get bread and butter when seated, you have to request it. They also took some good menu items away. All in all it is a decent experience and I quite possibly will return, but with so many other options in town it may be a while.

THE best gluten-free pizza I've EVER had, even better than BJ's Restaurant! The rice-flour crust was soft but not mushy, with excellent flavor. The tomato sauce was sweet and slightly spicy. The cheese was VERY stretchy; the real deal. I like the chunks of fresh basil and tomatoes, too (we got the Margharetta).  I like their GF appetizer options; the wedge salad had a sweet dressing offset by the rich bleu cheese and bacon. My friend got the corn-and-black-bean guacamole; I could try it because the mole itself is GF, but the chips are fried in a cross-contaminated fryer. The chewy corn gives texture to the creamy avocado, and the flavor of each ingredient is expressed.  My server, Lindsay, was attentive and quick, even when asking her lots of safety questions.  TOTALLY recommend this restaurant to the GF community--and everyone! TIP: Ask for napkins for your drinks; the restaurant doesn't have coasters, and the glasses "bleed" a lot!

First time here at this branch. Service was very good. The receptionist opened the door for us, which was very welcoming. Our server was also very friendly and attentive. In terms of food; their avocado roll tasted good, but I just wish it had more avocado in it. I was expecting it to highlight on the avocado, but it was more like bacon n cheese rolls with avocado, instead of "avocado rolls." The BBQ pizza with bacon tasted good too, but it's a little bit salty. Their jambalaya fettucini also tasted good. The ambience was nice and has a clean feel to it.  Overall, this restaurant was very nice. Will come back to it.

went to CPK a few weeks ago and had the Carne Asada pizza. It was one of the best pizzas I've ever had and my father even enjoyed it, which says a lot because he is very picky. Our waitress Miranda M. was super great and delivered efficient and fast service. We will definitely be back again to enjoy CPK in Fresno the next time I'm in town! The vibe in CPK was very lively and enjoyable for both families and friends. 10/10 would recommend! I will add that I really enjoyed the wine selection.

DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY! My food took a hour to come and it was cold like it's been in the refrigerator. I had to heat my pizza up in the oven. This place is 2 miles away there's no way my food should have been cold.

Pleasantly surprised. The food was great. Dumplings we're very tasty, lettuce wraps yummy & Hawaiian pizza was very good. Their 3rd party delivery company took an hour & half to get here but the food was still hot & the family was pleased. Will order again.

Food was good, place was loud, portions on plate were huge-- when I asked for the "healthy portion", there was way to much ! I only wanted 1/4 of what they "thought" was a healthy portion!  totally over priced for the taste, service was excellent

This is probably one of the better inexpensive chain restaurants in the area. It's not gourmet, but you always know what you're going to get--and fortunately, what you get usually tastes pretty good. The dining area is bright and clean, and the employees seem well-trained and friendly. I've dined at this location multiple times as well as ordered takeout, and I've never had any major complaints. The last time I ate there I tried a shrimp alfredo and found the sauce a bit too watery and that the tails were left on the shrimp, which I'm not a fan of in pasta dishes. You're probably best just sticking to the pizzas; my go-to is the BBQ Chicken. Apparently there are some healthier options available on the menu as well, if that's your thing. I'd probably rank their customer service four stars but their food just a three. Friendly service counts for a lot in my book, so I went with four stars overall.
We ordered pizza's, each of these were excellent. Really like using the Yelp delivery option.

Great food no matter what you pick but my favorite is the Moroccan chicken salad, If you prefer salads that is. The waiters/waitresses are attentive and friendly. Fun things to look at on the wall, but it's just a great atmosphere in general.

We recently had my daughter's 8th birthday party at CPK. It was fabulous! The manager, Kelly Baker, and his team took such great care of us. I'm still in awe. They made everyone in our party feel special. They gave each of them a chef's hat, asked them their names and what they'd like to drink. We had one guest who was running late and Kelly was very sweet and said he could push the tour 5 min. to wait four our last arrival. He then gave the kids a very fun Q&A tour. My daughter thought he was very funny. After the tour the kids made their own custom pizzas! That was not it! Ice cream sundaes were next! Everyone & everything was perfect. Thank you Kelly!

Service was good. Our waitress was very attentive. Our food came out licketty split. The food was mediocre. We got the garlic chicken pizza but to me the chicken tasted old so I shoo'd it off and then I didn't really taste garlic at all. We also got the dumplings and they were alright tasting. I don't guesstimate that I will be returning.
The meat cravers pizza. The four cheese ravioli. Order a side of shrimp. Order a side of chicken breast. Prosper.
We love the food!  But every time we order the salmon plate for lunch....and our office does a lot, it is so dry.  Can we maybe not cook so long and add a lemon or lime in container.
Great food as always. Food arrived cold but the place is across town. So I don't expect it to show up piping hot.

Food is overpriced. Good, but overpriced. Took 10-15 minutes to get one margarita.  Then other 25 minutes just to get the damn check. Kacey, the waitress, forgot about us. Literally. She said "oh sorry, i forgot about you".  Other than that, everything was okay.

We had a seriously delicious meal tonight using the $10 off $40 coupon in the app. Started with bread and oil and shared the garlic fettuccine (but substituted multi-grain penne & added chicken and broccolini). It adds up when you add on, but it was a large portion and full of flavor.  Finally we ended our meal with butter cake. Not as good as Lazy Dog's butter cake (and it costs more at CPK), but it's cake and contains a high amount of butter so it's all good.

The staff here was friendly enough. Trying to reach them over the phone though proved difficult so we ordered online. The pizza was not that great. It was nice to see gluten free crust options on the menu, but the pizza really lacked tomato sauce, which really took away from the flavor of the pizza over all.

I have been coming to this CPK since they opened. However, as of yet, I have to say their customer service has been over the top! The quality of the food coming to the table has been superb. What was just a stop for lunch as we drive down from Bass Lake, has become a traditional part of our day of shopping for supplies. I would like anyone who is checking Yelp for info on this location to run to this location, and when you get there, ask for the Manager Kelly Baker. Whatever he has done since he took over this location, has made a big difference in what was already a pleasant dining experience. Congratulations to Kelly and his Team, for a job well done.  Best, Jill H.

I've always been a fan of CPK. What is there not to love about a place that serves both unique pizza and pasta? This time however, instead of getting my usual grilled veggie pizza, I branched out (GASP) and got the tequila chicken fettuccine. YUMMERS. Lots of good lime flavor, but not overpowering. The pasta was perfectly cooked and green so that made me happy. All in all, I have never had a cause to not like this place. Its a good, reliable stand by.
Love this place...Always get the garlic chicken pizza and the butter pound cake with ice cream.. Simply delish!!

I have been to this place several times spread out over the course of MANY years (not by choice) and I've never enjoyed any of their food. I've tried it all, pizza, pasta, salad..its all very lack luster and over price. Plus YOU have to ASK for COMPLIMENTARY bread? I still to this day don't get why people like this place.

I call this place heaven of pizza.  I don't care what they charge. I don't care  how long it takes to cook.  Their customer service very good Favorite pizza: Chipotle chicken pizza & Vegetarian Egg plant without goat cheese. OMG its delicious. Every bite you take makes you want to close your eyes and say thank you thank you & Thank you Appetizer: Love their spinach dip with some chips.

solid 3.5  Havent been to this place for years. I remember it being pricey and weird. I"m a traditional kind of pizza girl, although Fresno's pizza scene is dismal at best.  I recently received a gift certificate for this place so we went. I have to say that I was very pleased.  Service 4 selection 3.5 Food 3.5 we had  a focaccia appetizer that was ok i wouldnt order it again I had some tequila lime pasta that was ok, not great but ok. However, my mom had the chicken salad sandwich and it was delicious! my sons had chicken bbq pizza - its their signature dish and very tasty.  it was about 55$ with tip not bad for dinner for 4

Five stars may be a bit generous but the last two visits have been very nice.  Tonight we had two appetizers and a pizza. One appetizer, the humus was not right and we sent it back. The spring roll appetizer was just about right as was the wild mushroom and chicken pizza.  The best thing about this restaurant is the comfort, decor and general ambiance. It's comfortable and that makes up for any imperfections in the food.  Perfect food does not exist in this town so we are now down to measuring comfort as the main prerequisite for satisfaction.
Horrible pizza, not that I expect much of a chain restaurants, but their pies fall terribly short of expectations and are certainly not worth the high prices.

been here a handful of times, the last being last night.  consistently average service.  You really cant go wrong with one of their pizzas.  Not the best ever, but definitely tasty I havent had anything else off their menu, but the selection looks decent.   price is a bit above average, but not horrible. basically it's just consistently an OK place to eat.  there is better, but there are far worse.
The pizza is very good and the service was great! They had accidentally put onions on my pizza but I just picked them off. Then the waitress brought me a new one without onions. Free pizza! ALRIGHT!

My wife and I eat here 2-3 times per week.  What keeps us coming back are the delicious pizzas and the fresh salads.  The service is always good, and it's good to see the restaurant manager walking around and helping out the staff where needed.  The price of the food is a little high, and that's the only downside.

Minions, Evil is told that the cool people call this place "CPK". Evil calls it CraP...K?   You see, Evil has simple tastes.  Pizza should have tomato sauce and mozzarella cheese and some kind of meat and/or vegetable. Crap...K? serves nothing but the "gourmet" stuff.  The problem is that it just doesn't taste that great.  And it is damn expensive. Evil isn't made of money, yo! They do have some pretty good salads, but really...you can get a salad just about anywhere else in town without having to pay the fortune you'll have to pay at CraP...K? We are giving 2 stars because our server, Meagan, was super cute and very nice...  she earned a big tip from Evil.
Great waiter, nice bright dining area.  My only "issue" was that they could not offer ANYTHING for my wife who is eating gluten free. For the chain itself...kind of pricey!!  Good food.

Things that happened at CPK last night: 1)  We came in a large party (14+).  A few folks in our party ordered the Kung Pao Spaghetti, but one person ordered it without peanuts.  The food took a long time to arrive, and when it did one of the servers messed up and gave the no-peanuts Kung Pao to the wrong person, who already started eating it so it was too late to swap.  Oddly enough, the server didn't tell the person who got the no-peanuts Kung Pao that their dish didn't have peanuts and just assumed that they would be OK with it.  To make matters worse, apparently they ran out of spaghetti so they had to remake the dish (which already took too long to come out) without peanutes and with a different type of pasta.  To make matters even worse, the restaurant didn't even have the decency to offer some kind of discount for their screw up.  They charged full price. 2)  I had ordered the 2 for $30 deal and nothing else.  When the bill came, it was $50.  When I asked the server why my bill was so high, her automatic response was, "oh it's tax and tip," which, obviously, uh no.  I told her I don't think she charged us right, she eventually agreed and took the bill to her manager.  So bill #2 comes back and this time it's around $40, with a $7 tip, which amounts to a ~21% tip even if the tip was calculated after tax.  Evidently, the only thing the server changed was the base price of the meal and she didn't recalculate her 18% gratuity based on the lower price.  So the tip was calculated based on the incorrect higher price from the first bill.  Ultimately, the second bill overcharged me by about a dollar.  For a half second I thought about whether I should send the bill back AGAIN, but eventually just let it slide since she already demonstrated a deficiency in math so she probably didn't do it on purpose.  Enjoy your extra dollar (hopefully on a math book). I have to give CPK some credit for having decent tasting food, huge portions and reasonable prices (when they charge you correctly).  However, yesterday's service was pretty bad so IMO there's no reason to go unless someone else in your group is really craving it.
Always satisfied when we eat here. Love love love this place. I especially like the one who is training the waiters he was very helpful and wow! what a gem you guys got. The food is amazing!!!!
The classic BBQ chicken pizza was good times.  The mac n cheese was pretty tasty, surprisingly.  And the staff was very friendly and attentive.

I love this place a lot. People always say that the food is overpriced, blah blah blah. Yeah it is a bit pricier than just a regular pizzeria and that's because the food seems way fresher than most pizza places I've been to. I also think the location has some factor on the price, it's a nice part of town so obviously it's a little bit more. The waitress I had was so sweet and caring, she had a great personality and wasn't forcing anything on us, that's a rare trait. I really like how attentive everyone is at this restaurant, I'll see the managers talking to tables and taking the kids into the kitchen to flip dough and what place does that besides Cpk? NO WHERE. Idk why there are some negative feedback from certain people about Cpk? I went there and they made me want to go again it was that good. Some people can be assholes to people in the restaurant business, some customers can just be rude. I say try this place before you listen to all the BS. You have to try the tostada pizza it's AMAZING

Service was good, their blue moon was good, pizza was pretty good, but they are kinda over priced for their portion. This place overall was okay, not bad but not excellent. 4 stars for their service, 2 for their price of their portion

I went there for dinner. The hostess had her back turned to the door and was talking on the phone for 6 minutes. I stood there for the 6 minutes.  She never even turned around. I left and went next door to the Elephant bar.

Terrible, just terrible!!  My mother and I stopped in to CPK for a quick bite and the there was definately nothing quick about our visit.  They weren't exetremely busy at all.  We waited about 40 minutes for our pizzas but never received them because we got tired of waiting.  The waiter checked on us maybe 2 times and seemed to have tables all over the restaurant.  When I finally told him that we were leaving he simply appologized said he'd alert the manager.  Shame I used to like this place.  Not sure well be making another visit!!!

Super busy at lunch yet an entire section was left unopened. Our server was obviously distracted and we waited EXTREMELY long for lettuce wraps and taco (those shouldn't take 1 hour+ to make). They also got rid of the ONLY reason I ever went there before, The Singapore Shrimp Rolls! So sad, won't be back anytime soon.
This was my first time here  Customer service is excellent they always ask how are food was and how we are doing food was delicious really busy on a saturday evening

My husband and I went here for lunch after church. It was not terribly busy but we were there almost 2 hours! To start, we didn't get our complimentary bread- we had to ask for it while we were ordering our food. Honest mistake, no big deal. Then I had something floating around in my Sprite. It got changed out immediately. We didn't have any napkins when our appetizer came. Then when we got our food, we had no silverware. We let our waitress know and after almost 10 minutes, I grabbed some from a clean table nearby. My husband initially ordered a Cherry Coke and the 2 refills after that were regular Coke. The food was good but the bad service was enough for us not to go there again.

Have been coming here for several years. Always order the same thing, the wait staff who serve me at curbside even know I am allergic to avocado. I ordered a salad tonight and clearly said NO AVOCADO. I had a long day and just got home to eat my salad. Imagine my shock when it was full of avocado. I called the restaraunt, that is now closed, and told the girl who answered about the salad. She got a manager on the phone. I was polite but not happy. She must have been having a bad night because there was no apology at all and the first thing she said was "what do you want me to do about it"? After I recovered from being taken aback from this question I said I would come in tomorrow and get the correct salad. She said she couldn't do that, that she would have to either send me something in the mail or reverse the charges. I told her to reverse the charges. When she looked up the order she said I did ask for avocado. No...that was my sons. After enduring her tone I asked her if she was upset with me, because it sure did seem that way. Then I got the lecture. It was at this point I realized she didn't care and I just wanted the call over with. She reversed the charges on my card, I hung up. As a very regular customer I find this so disappointing. My food allergy is very serious and I have always appreciated the extra care CPK seemed to take when it came to this. I guess I would have expected the management to at least act like they cared and not treated me in such a manner. Pretty sure they can look back in their records and see this is the same order, pretty much every time, and I have ordered this A LOT. Very disappointed and discouraged with them today.

My boyfriend and I went to have lunch. We took our large pit bull (service dog with his vest on and card) they didn't give us a hard time, our service was amazing, outdoor area shaded and in front of the fountain, food was great and they also brought our dog a bowl of water. It's the little things that make all the diffrence. We never know what places will be rude or give us bad service when we have our dog with us.

Ok first off let me say I'm all the bang for the buck  and to me CPF is not the place for me.  The food was good not great the service was adequate and the price is  way overinflated but yeah if you like wine  or sangria with your meals at lunch and gossip about your co workers or niehbor a. With your snooty richly rich attitude you fit right it. Lol.   Really tho girlfriend and me took her 2 grand kids and my daughter  and the cost was like 75.oo. And we left hungry.   Anyways. 3. Stars.  Will never go  back!!!!
Service is what you expect, efficient .  Do not order bbq chicken sandwich, it was lacking any real flavor.

Okay, so I went into this place with my girlfriend because we had a gift card. We don't drink soda really, so we ordered water, a pizza, and a appetizer. The appetizer comes out and my girlfriend asks me, "is that a hair?" I reply, "no, it is probably just melted cheese." I go to show her and sure enough pull out a small strand of hair. I put it back on the plate and inform the waitress. I didnt want to make a scene or anything free. I just wanted a fresh batch. I use to work in a kitchen and things happen, they shouldn't, but they do. She was very curteous and took them back to get me a new order. Shortly after a manager comes over who I watched walk over from the other side of the restaurant without ever going into the kitchen himself  (they wear earpieces) and tells me, "That wasn't a hair, that was cheese." I had to bite my tongue from telling the guy off. First off, very very unprofessional, second off don't spit on my steak and call it gravy. I pulled the hair out myself. The only reason I gave it 2 stars is because the waitress was nice and the pizza itself was good. Would I go to CPK again, yes. Would I go to this CPK again, most likely not.
Things are changing here. I'm not big on change, so I stick with the sure hits-Grilled Chicken Caesar. Delish, and doesn't disappoint. Mid week was very quiet. We were surprised.

We are not huge fans of most chain restaurants, but the lady was craving some Cal Pizza Kitchen (she frequented another location during college and hasn't had it since), so we decided to go out. When we arrived at 7pm, it was a typical Friday night: busy.  We waited a brief 20 minutes outside and were seated promptly.  Being a party of two meant quicker seating at one of the many 1x1 booths. Five stars so far. (We did notice that when we were seated an overwhelming number of tables hadn't been cleared which was contributing to the long delay) One seated, we waited several minutes before getting menus and drink orders.  The unsettling part is the waitress who eventually served us had passed by multiple times.  A simple "I'll be right with you guys" would've gone a long way. -0.5 stars When we placed our drink order, we also ordered the corn guacamole from the small plates menu.  We both enjoyed everything about it.  Still no drinks. -1.0 stars We ordered a cobb salad on romaine with blue cheese dressing & beets, five cheese and fresh tomato pizza and two cups of soup; the soup is what the Mrs was craving the most.  The waitress asked if we would like the soup first to which we confirmed.  After a surprisingly short wait the food arrived and the drinks soon followed.  We asked about the soup and the gentleman said he would check.  He ended up bringing only one cup at our request.  The pizza was great and the salad was fresh.  However, the salad was coated with ranch, not blue cheese.  We also had to ask for utensils.  -0.5 stars for each. The most frustrating part about our experience seemed to be everyone except our waitress.  Knowing how Ca Pizza Kitchen works their tips, it was painful to not tip normally. All in all, good food but horrible support service.  If we go back it will have to be during mid-week.  Or maybe not for another three years.

I was out in Fresno for work and a co-worker mentioned this place was good and that we should give it a try.  I am from NY so I am a pizza critic for sure.  Well, I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised at just how good this pizza was.  I was expecting average pizza, but it was definitely very good pizza!

My hubby and I went here last night. The service was great. We were seated right away and our waitress came over to us very quickly. She was very informative when we asked about ingredients from one of their dishes. She was over quite often with refills for our drinks (and we drink a lot) and our food was awesome. We had a great date night. Thanks California pizza kitchen

After coming back from a trip to New York and Brooklyn I understood what good pizza should taste like. I came here with my two young kids. They each ordered their kids pizza and I ordered a lunch special which was a mushroom and spinach personal pizza with a chicken Caesar salad. They also brought us warm bread with warm olive oil and basil--- so delicious. The pizza crust was thin, light and airy- the way real pizza should be! You can tell they are using real dough, not frozen. And I've also been to Italy where they make pizza this way. Ingredients were fresh and full of flavor. Needless to say, we ate everything and my kids each finished their pizzas as well (which they can never quite finish anything). I definitely recommend this place and will be coming back for more!

We wanted to ride our bikes to a restaurant that has a patio so we could keep an eye on them while eating. We choose CPK because of this. We had the patio to ourselves which was surprising as the evening was very pleasant. We were promptly seated and our waiter, Mikey, greeted us immediately and took our drink orders. He personally made our Long Island ice teas which, for the first time anywhere, were every bit as delicious as TGIF's recipe. We ordered a Hawaiian pizza which was cooked perfectly. Mikey was an outstanding waiter and was attentive without being overly so. CPK was smart to hire him. The only reason I did not give this establishment a 5 star rating is that the patio was in desperate need of a deep cleaning, mainly the tile floor needs a good streaming to erase all of the unappealing stains.

3.5, to be exact. The handful of times that I've eaten at CPK, I've actually really enjoyed it. If you're looking for something different from your traditional pizza, then this spot is definitely up for suggestion. Also, I DO love the fact that the food is somewhat lighter than your average. I can still breathe after inhaling an entire order of pizza, and not leave feeling like oily goodness is seeping through my pores. Or is that just me? I have yet to try a pizza or salad that I don't like here; however, maybe this place is just too commercial for me (who knows?) because it's never a place I PERSONALLY choose. Perhaps it may be the the lack of service. My customer service experiences with Fresno's have been somewhat subpar - not that any of the waiters or waitresses are rude - just not very attentive, I guess. Whatever the case, no complaints here food-wise (in reference to all CPK's in general).
Great Gluten Free pizza! Staff was nice and we didn't wait too long. I have to be cautious of where I eat as I can get sick from gluten. Had a good experience and will be going again.

I come here a few times a month. The food is consistently good - I like the variety of the items on the menu. You could either say the portions are a little small for the price or the prices are a little on the high side for what you get hah. Service is good - the servers have always been very friendly/accommodating, and sometimes exceptional.  Sometimes it does take longer than I would like to get food but I enjoy my dining experience enough to come back frequently.  And free wifi.

We came in at 8:30pm which was 30min before closing time but experienced the best, most professional service ever. Our waiter was very sweet as well as the waiters in the sections around us. Food was delicious!

Went here on Father's day right at closing time, about 30 mins before. They were friendly and seated us prompty. Professional staff totally opposite from another company we tried to dine at in santa cruz, decided to just drive all the way back home to fresno to eat here, a place we never been. This was the best pizza I have had in a long time. Again, the staff was professional and friendly, even the waters were filled constantly. Food presented nice too!

The pizza here is good but average. It was really nothing special to me and is overpriced, in my opinion. If you come here, make sure it's for the atmosphere and fun experience, not for amazing pizza. I had the fully loaded "combination" pizza (I guess you could call it) and it was pretty good, the veggies were fresh and everything tasted as expected. The food came out quick and hot, and the portions are ok...good for 1 to 2 people.  I also had the mango and strawberry mojotos, which were pretty tasty but the bartender took forever and a day to make my drinks. I waited like 15 minutes for my drink to come once the waitress took my order and the bar was dead! So there was no excuse for the service to take as long as it did. Thats my only real gripe about this place. The customer service was good and the workers were friendly. The restaurant was extremely clean and well organized, which I loved. I'd come back just for a little lunch with a group of friends.
I have eaten 5 or 6 times at this location.  Always good service and cold beer.  I get the classic BBQ chicken pizza every time and it is consistently tasty.

Great place if your feeling like something a little different than the regular kind of pizza, its an Italian gourmet type place so its not just a regular pizza joint. Food has always been tasty and never had a bad service experience. My favorite is the vegetarian eggplant pizza. tons of veggies on it and my friend i usually go with always gets the chicken sandwich. we share what we get and we always leave very satisfied. Always been clean, nice deco, no big issues for me. if i got the money to go here i would always be down to go.
Love it! I want to give a shout out to Jason the bartender". He has great customer service and he's down to earth. Made a very hot day feel warm.

For the record, we didn't eat the food here. My family called and asked them to set up a table. They said if we were there within 15 minutes that would be fine. We arrived 10 minutes later and they had given away our table to another party 5 minutes before we arrived. Wtf? They said they could sit us at 2 tables. I didn't say it, but our family isn't able to get together much. We are all in town because my Nonno passed away. Kind of important for us to sit together. We left that bootsie place and went to P.F. Changs.

Week night service was good, but the food was only ok, in my opinion.  Their pepperoni pizza was truly unimpressive.  It tastes cheap and sweetish.  Sort of like a take and bake from costco (which I am Not a fan of).  Overall, for the price I don't think this place is worth it.

Always good food when you are in need of CPK, never an error. Okay, only one. I was charged on my card a $5.50 tip when we left the gratuity in cash, but the problem was hastily remedied and back in my account within 48 hours. So no dings off the top score. I recommend the Sicilian on regular crust. And if pasta is more your thing, there Chicken Marsala hits the spot.

the original bbq chicken chopped salad is definitely not a healthy salad but that might be why its so damn good the hawaiian bbq chicken pizza is delicious ask for some extra pineapples and it makes it even better!! i have yet to receive any red flags on service from my visits the service has always been nice i have yet to find an AMAZING appetizer from them yet but the white corn guacamole and chips, and the lettuce wraps are ok
Really good food. As good as a CPK can be. The pizza's were yummy. I enjoyed the tequila chicken.

Cold pizza + lame green salad with a cup of ranch dumped on top despite asking for it to be on the side + one measley water refil + two undrinkable glasses of wine = $32.95 + Tip. Another example of why I hate on chain restaurants.
Well first time to the place. Got the cpk cobb salad and WOW super great.  Give it a try. The service was good for been mothers day and very busy.
I love the food, specially the Maui punch when you there you have to try it. Along with Chinese salad. The pizza is good could use some work. Overall its a great place.
Aside from being kinda spendy for what you get, it's really good.  I love the chicken sandwiches and their pasta is really good too.
Why do I keep going back?!?  Curbside gets my order wrong nearly every time!!!  Don't ever leave without checking your order first!!!

Even though I drive by this place everyday, when some friends said they were meeting at CPK for dinner, I had to ask where it was. I guess I'm ambivalent about this place. I'd wouldn't be my first choice for pizza, even though Fresno hasn't really proven to me that it's a pizza town. Having said all that, I like their pepperoni, sausage, and mushroom pizza on their honey wheat crust. Again, I seem to be getting better service in Fresno than K.I. which is kinda weird. I'm taking off one star for the heartburn though.

Service was great. Possibly because I was sitting at the bar and was practically the only person in restaurant. I went right when they opened...The rosemary chicken something or other sandwich was very good as well as the cream of asparagus soup. I've only had the pizza here once. It had shrimp on it. That particular pizza is no longer on the menu, thank God cause it sucked! Cheers!

Food is great.  Sit Down service is good. Carside/Takeout -SUCKS!! I have tried the call ahead for carside take out 3 times and everytime has been a nightmare.  The first time, I could not park in the marked stall for the carside and ended up parking at the other end of the parking lot and walking in.  The next time I got a parking spot, called and let them know I was there and no one ever came out to me.  After a 15 minute wait, I went in and the guys tells me that he had no idea I was even there waiting.  Apparently the chick answering the phone forgot to tell him.  PISSED ME OFF!!!  This last time and final time (as I will not do carside/takeout again) I get there, park, call and wait!! 12 minutes later as I and just getting my stuff together to get out of the car, the guy comes running out with my food.  I tell him that they are really slow and this was bad service and he just shrugs! WTF!!! Needless to say the only reason they get three stars is because the food is good.  Otherwise, they would get a big fat zero!!
I've been here a few times and the wait staff have always been quite nice and mannerly. Always seated fast and food comes out hot. No compliants.

They offer a wide range of specialty pizzas. I my favorite is the original BBQ chicken pizza. Their pizzas range from $12-$18 which is very pricey when they are the size of a Me-N-Eds personal pizza. Besides their pizzas they also offer many different pastas and salads.  Since it is located in River Park you have to realize your paying more for the nicer atmosphere compared to a pizza parlor. It is a classy place and is fun to go with a group or a date. My waiters have always done an exceptional job and their is usually only a five minute wait to be seated. I would recommend this place to any gourmet pizzas lover!

I went in yesterday...food is not so gr8. Also service is not so professional. He was polite ..but heen to ask him for everytime. I have been to many other CPK but this is the worst CPK ihave ever went.  Taste of the pizza is not so gr8. I ordered two pizzas...but not so gr8. try to avoid if u want real CPK. Not worth the money

My only gripe about CPK (in general) is that as they've expanded their non- pizza offerings, the pizzas on the menu have dwindled and suffered.  Furthermore, some more "exotic" pizzas have disappeared all together.  For example, peking duck was replaced with Also, don't think of CPK as a pizza place, because their pizzas are seldom "pizza" by the traditional terms. In terms of the Fresno location, even though they don't take reservations, I've never had to wait more than 15 minutes or so.  The main drawback is that the design of the space, with tall wood beam ceilings, causes the space to be very loud.
Great food, not just the pizza.  A lot of different options and the price is very reasonable.  Staff was very friendly.
Our food was good, and the service was ok considering the place was packed.
